sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: What is the area of a trapezoid with a height of 6 units and bases of 9 units and 13 units, respectively?
message_2:
To find the area of a trapezoid, we use the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (base1 + base2) × height

In this case, base1 = 9 units, base2 = 13 units, and height = 6 units. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area = (1/2) × (9 + 13) × 6
Area = (1/2) × 22 × 6
Area = 11 × 6
Area = 66 square units

So, the area of the trapezoid is 66 square units.
